column4: How can I get my floppy drive to read my Floppies? I mount it, click on it and a File manager window opens, but it is blank. Thanx ---ed
in a terminal I'd try "df" and see if floppy is listed, and if it's 1.4MB free (meaning nothing on the  floppy disk)
they your floppy isn't mounted - it will show up as sdX where X is your next available drive letter
The floppy icon shows it's mounted
they try looking in ~/.gvfs and see if anything is in there
The terminal states: /home/eda/.gvfs: is a directory
correct - it's where Gnome mounts its "virtual" stuff
Now what?
is anything in that directory?
How do I find out?
look inside that directory with Nautilus (file manager) or use "ls" in a terminal
This is what I did & reply:  eda@Lin:~$ ls
you need to "cd .gvfs" first
I entered eda@Lin:~/.gvfs$ ls  & got this: eda@Lin:~/.gvfs$ ls
so it doesn't seem like your floppy is mounted?!  Sorry I'm not sure what's wrong - best of luck.
Thank you. I used to know how to do all this when I started with my XT PC with DOS.
have you tried "sudo mount /dev/fd0 /mnt"?
I tried "sudo mount /dev/fd0 /mnt" the drive light comes on , the icon shows it  mounted & file manager is empty. I tried with several Mfr's floppies & nothing!
you would need to be looking in /mnt with the mount command i gave you...
Thanks for your help. I need to take a break, I'm very tired.
best of luck!
